00022 using namespace std;

00024 struct BindingEnv;
00025 
00026 /// A single parsed token in an input stream.
00027 struct Token {
00028   enum Type {
00029     NONE,
00030     UNKNOWN,
00031     IDENT,
00032     NEWLINE,
00033     EQUALS,
00034     COLON,
00035     PIPE,
00036     PIPE2,
00037     INDENT,
00038     OUTDENT,
00039     TEOF
00040   };
00041   explicit Token(Type type) : type_(type) {}
00042 
00043   void Clear() { type_ = NONE; }
00044   string AsString() const;
00045 
00046   Type type_;
00047   const char* pos_;
00048   const char* end_;
00049 };
00050 
00051 /// Represents a user-understandable position within a source file.
00052 struct SourceLocation {
00053   SourceLocation(int line, int col) : line_(line), column_(col) {}
00054 
00055   /// Construct an error message based on the position and message,
00056   /// write it into \a err, then return false.
00057   bool Error(const string& message, string* err);
00058 
00059   /// 1-based line and column numbers.
00060   int line_;
00061   int column_;
00062 };
00063 
00064 /// Processes an input stream into Tokens.
00065 struct Tokenizer {
00066   Tokenizer()
00067     : makefile_flavor_(false),
00068       token_(Token::NONE), line_number_(0),
00069       last_indent_(0), cur_indent_(-1) {}
00070 
00071   /// Tokenization differs slightly between ninja files and Makefiles.
00072   /// By default we tokenize as ninja files; calling this changes to
00073   /// Makefile-style tokenization.
00074   void SetMakefileFlavor() {
00075     makefile_flavor_ = true;
00076   }
00077 
00078   void Start(const char* start, const char* end);
00079   /// Report an error with a location pointing at the current token.
00080   bool Error(const string& message, string* err);
00081   /// Call Error() with "expected foo, got bar".
00082   bool ErrorExpected(const string& expected, string* err);
00083 
00084   const Token& token() const { return token_; }
00085 
00086   void SkipWhitespace(bool newline=false);
00087   bool Newline(string* err);
00088   bool ExpectToken(Token::Type expected, string* err);
00089   bool ExpectIdent(const char* expected, string* err);
00090   bool ReadIdent(string* out);
00091   bool ReadToNewline(string* text, string* err,
00092                      size_t max_length=std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max());
00093 
00094   Token::Type PeekToken();
00095   void ConsumeToken();
00096 
00097   SourceLocation Location() {
00098     return SourceLocation(line_number_ + 1, token_.pos_ - cur_line_ + 1);
00099   }
00100 
00101   bool makefile_flavor_;
00102 
00103   const char* cur_;
00104   const char* end_;
00105 
00106   const char* cur_line_;
00107   Token token_;
00108   int line_number_;
00109   int last_indent_, cur_indent_;
00110 };
00111 
00112 /// Parses simple Makefiles as generated by gcc.
00113 struct MakefileParser {
00114   MakefileParser();
00115   bool Parse(const string& input, string* err);
00116 
00117   Tokenizer tokenizer_;
00118   string out_;
00119   vector<string> ins_;
00120 };

00122 struct EvalString;
00123 struct State;
00124 
00125 /// Parses .ninja files.
00126 struct ManifestParser {
00127   struct FileReader {
00128     virtual ~FileReader() {}
00129     virtual bool ReadFile(const string& path, string* content, string* err) = 0;
00130   };
00131 
00132   ManifestParser(State* state, FileReader* file_reader);
00133 
00134   bool Load(const string& filename, string* err);
00135   bool Parse(const string& input, string* err);
00136 
00137   bool ParseRule(string* err);
00138   /// Parse a key=val statement, expanding $vars in the value with the
00139   /// current env.
00140   bool ParseLet(string* key, string* val, string* err);
00141   bool ParseEdge(string* err);
00142 
00143   /// Parse either a 'subninja' or 'include' line.
00144   bool ParseFileInclude(string* err);
00145 
00146 
00147   /// Parse the "key=" half of a key=val statement.
00148   bool ParseLetKey(string* key, string* err);
00149   /// Parse the val half of a key=val statement, writing and parsing
00150   /// output into an EvalString (ready for expansion).
00151   bool ParseLetValue(EvalString* eval, string* err);
00152 
00153   State* state_;
00154   BindingEnv* env_;
00155   FileReader* file_reader_;
00156   Tokenizer tokenizer_;
00157 };
